Draft Rating:

D+

Elgin Baylor ranks in the 34th percentile for drafting among executives in our database. Baylor's draft picks average out to be worth the equivalent of 5 spots lower than they were picked due to their terrible drafting.
Some of their biggest wins:
  • Drafted DeAndre Jordan with 35th pick but was worth 6th pick.
  • Drafted Rob Lock with 51th pick but was worth 20th pick.
  • Drafted Tom Garrick with 45th pick but was worth 33th pick.
Some of their biggest busts:
  • Drafted Michael Olowokandi with 1th pick but was worth 56th pick.
  • Drafted Lorenzen Wright with 7th pick but was worth 47th pick.
  • Drafted Reggie Williams with 4th pick but was worth 10th pick.

Trade Rating:

D+

Elgin Baylor ranks in the 33th percentile for trading among executives in our database.
Their biggest win:
  • Added Elton Brand to LAC.
  • Lost Tyson Chandler, Brian Skinner to CHI.
Their biggest L:
  • Added Eric Piatkowski, Pooh Richardson, Malik Sealy to LAC.
  • Lost Mark Jackson, Greg Minor to IND.

Signing Rating:

F

Elgin Baylor ranks in the 11th percentile for free agency signings among executives in our database.
Their best signings:
  • Signed Bo Outlaw in 1994.
  • Signed Baron Davis in 2008.
  • Signed Harold Ellis in 1994.
Their worst signings:
  • Signed Quinton Ross in 2004.
  • Signed Cuttino Mobley in 2005.
  • Signed Jeff McInnis in 2000.
